content.description: The best crack route in the entire pit. Aptly named. There are many ways to begin. I like to jam the crack and grovel to the chimney. Others like to go spread eagle and stem to the chimney. Some try, well, all sorts of things. Its not that bad. Its actually really fun. Dont miss this one because it is amazing!
content.protection: The yapper takes passive gear like a champ. I even a heard a story where a directional cam blew and struck a pour top-roper in the face. Priceless.  But really, single set of stuff to 3". The only bolts on this climb are the anchors after all this isnt jack's canyon.
content.location: The only crack/chimney system on the bulldog wall.

content.description: Why Be is the most overhanging route on The Bulldog. It has a bouldery start to an easy, slightly runout finish.
content.location: Just left and around the corner from Blackboard

climbs.name: One Beer Shy of a Lunar Eclipse

content.description: Fun route! A little tricky at the start (hands and feet) but bulges and ledges provide some nice options higher up. This route appears in an old Arizona climbing guide book and it's well bolted; I'm surprised it wasn't already on Mountain Project.
content.location: Ten feet left of the crack that marks Yappin' Chihuahua, on Bulldog

content.description: An okay warmup, you pull a handfull of moves on a short wall before passing a slight bulge to the anchors.
content.location: On the wall facing The Sun Tower

content.description: The Bulldog has two different aspects, both very short and probably only worth climbing if nearby routes are already taken.
